title: INfinance
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: ‘I’m 68 and my 401(k) has dwindled to $82,000’: My husband committed financial infidelity and has $50,000 in credit-card debt. What now?
items.description: “I have $3,000 in gold and Social Security income for me and my spouse makes $46,180 a year.”

items.title: My mother-in-law, 95, has $400K in stocks. Would it be smarter taxwise to gift it to her kids — or leave it to them in her will?
items.description: “What is the smartest way to go about this? Will she be taxed?”

items.title: U.S. Steel’s stock surges as Trump gets his wish and a ‘golden share’
items.description: U.S. Steel’s so-called “partnership” with Nippon appears to be nearing its end after about 18 months after it was announced.

items.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
items.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

items.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
